Package grabbables

Class Deck<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • grabbables.Deck<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - is an iterable
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<T>
    public class Deck<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<T>
    This class implements a deck of shuffled elements where already used elements can be added to the deck in case more requests are made than there are cards in the deck

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Deck​(Tuple3<java.util.List<T>,​java.util.Set<T>,​java.util.Set<T>> savedState)
      This method creates a Deck class from a saved state, preserving the original ordering of the deckIterator
      Deck​(java.util.Collection<T> originalDeck)
      The constructor takes a collection of elements it will have to randomize and creates an Iterator from which an element will be taken as needed and a stash in which discarded elements will be kept until the iterator empties

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void discard​(T card)
      This method grows the stash, in which cards are stored after having been discarded until the deck has been emptied, at which point the stash is converted into a randomized iterator
      Tuple3<java.util.List<T>,​java.util.Set<T>,​java.util.Set<T>> getDeckState()
      This method turns the information contained in the Deck into a tuple for storage.
      boolean hasNext()  
      boolean isPicked​(T card)
      This methods checks if the card is in the pickedCard set.
      T next()  
      java.util.Collection<T> take​(int maxN)
      Safely take one or more elements at once, this does not guarantee exactly maxN elements will be returned

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        forEachRemaining, remove

    • Constructor Detail

      • Deck

        public Deck​(Tuple3<java.util.List<T>,​java.util.Set<T>,​java.util.Set<T>> savedState)
        This method creates a Deck class from a saved state, preserving the original ordering of the deckIterator
        Parameters:
        savedState - the Tuple used to store information previously generated by getDeckState

      • Deck

        public Deck​(java.util.Collection<T> originalDeck)
        The constructor takes a collection of elements it will have to randomize and creates an Iterator from which an element will be taken as needed and a stash in which discarded elements will be kept until the iterator empties
        Parameters:
        originalDeck - will contain all the elements the deck will have to provide, the elements passed to the constructor should not be used further before they have been returned by the iterator

    • Method Detail

      • next

        public T next()
        Specified by:
        next in interface java.util.Iterator<T>
        Returns:
        The element on top of the deck, if the deckIterator is empty it empties the stash by creating a new deckIterator with its contents

      • take

        public java.util.Collection<T> take​(int maxN)
        Safely take one or more elements at once, this does not guarantee exactly maxN elements will be returned
        Parameters:
        maxN - the maximum amount requested by the caller
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing a number of elements equal to the lowest between maxN and the number of cards in the deckIterator and stash combined

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface java.util.Iterator<T>
        Returns:
        True if there is at least an element in either the stash or the deckIterator

      • discard

        public void discard​(T card)
        This method grows the stash, in which cards are stored after having been discarded until the deck has been emptied, at which point the stash is converted into a randomized iterator
        Parameters:
        card - the card which has been used and needs to be discarded, the card should not be accessed by any other class after it has been passed as a parameter to discard and until the point it is taken from the deck by calling next

      • isPicked

        public boolean isPicked​(T card)
        This methods checks if the card is in the pickedCard set. Typically a card can be used only if it is not in the Stash or in the Deck
        Parameters:
        card - The card that is requested to check
        Returns:
        True if the card is not in the Deck or in the Stash

      • getDeckState

        public Tuple3<java.util.List<T>,​java.util.Set<T>,​java.util.Set<T>> getDeckState()
        This method turns the information contained in the Deck into a tuple for storage. Calling the method destroys the Deck class, and if the class were still needed it'd have to be constructed using the appropriate constructor
        Returns:
        A tuple where the first element is a List of the cards in the iterator, in the order they'd have been uncovered, the second element is an unordered set of the cards stashed for future use
